data.title: Analysing digipaks and advertisment material
data.meta_description: Analysing digipaks and advertisment material - Download as a PDF or view online for free
data.text:
2. CHERYL COLE: A MILLION LIGHTS Same font adopted for artist name and main title on advert, represents the synergous link between both materials On both materials, we can see a ‘one-eye covered’ concept running through both. This is symbolic, as with the tattoo on her hand which is visible in both materials There is a very similar palette of colours being used for the colour scheme. Purple, pink, and subtle touches of limey yellow Options to share the word with friends on social networks, word of mouth promotion for the album and single Clear release dates for both single and album availability, letting consumers know when they can pick up a copy

3. DRAKE – TAKE CARE Parental advisory sign displayed to advise parents of explicit lyrics within the album Placement of chains jewellery and gold may be suggestive of the themes expressed in the album Track listing placed in orderly fashion, upholds album theme, appropriate placement of label logos and info Clear image of the artist in the centre,, a presentation of the artist who has made the music Artist image remains in the centre for full attention. Looking downwards, similar to the album cover, further establishing links between the two products Same location used in both the album cover and tour advert, creates clear link between the two products Uses a simple three colour scheme throughout the front and back, simplicity creates subtle attraction to the album Placement of album title ensures clarity and quickly identifiable. Uses a particular font, possibly representing the artists styling preference Ticket provider logo shown to let people know where to purchase tickets for the tour Album artwork along with release date shown to let consumers know when it’s available to buy
